subject: Communication
title: Burden of Proof: Who Must Prove What?
description: A quick, practical guide to Burden of Proof: Who Must Prove What?.

hook.text: I say there's an invisible dragon in my garage. You can't prove there isn't. Does that mean there is? Of course not.

buildup.text: Burden of proof lies with the claimant. The more extraordinary the claim, the more extraordinary the evidence must be.

discovery.text: In law: 'innocent until proven guilty.' In science: new claims must survive peer review.

twist.text: People constantly shift the burden: 'Prove God doesn't exist' or 'Prove this supplement doesn't work.

climax.text: Recognizing burden of proof manipulation is a core critical thinking skill.

punchline.text: If someone shifts the burden of proof, they've already lost the argument.

quiz.question: Who bears the burden of proof in an argument?
